channel.title: Question about effigies
channel.description:
My friend asked me a question about them today and i also started wondering about how they work.
Is it true that if you have lots of starved ones (which is first stage) you won't get any more effigy drops because you know.. i'm not sure how exactly to explain but since they're not stackable and may be like this: 30 IDs of starved effigies 35 of nourshed, etc, etc..
Another example: ID - Item: 7888 - Starved effigy 7889 - Starved effigy 7890 - Starved effigy
Or is it basically just 10 item ids max that are made when you click on them it generates you 2 random skills and then saves to your char file.
Anyone getting me? Does the effigy amount have a limit or it works different as explained above? Sorry but it's really hard to explain my question as english is not my language.

item.title: Question about effigies
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

They aren’t exactly random…http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Ancient_effigy

There are 8 kinds of effigies, each for the types of starved (req: level 91), nourished (req: 93), sated (95), and gorged (97). Each kind of effigy utilizes 2 pairs of skills, one which can be assisted and one which cannot. They do not stack because Jagex probably didn’t want people to be able to collect hundreds of them, not because they have changing ids (which actually doesn’t make much sense in how the client engine works). And I believe people have had upwards of 70-80 of these at once, so no there really is no limit, other than bankspace.

Edit: I will note that you cannot bank the dragonkin lamp, though. There is no limit to how many you have, other than inventory space. But just don’t go around using all your effigies until you are sure you know what you want to use the lamp on. Remember you get more experience with higher levels, so it’s wise to save your dragonkin lamps for at least 80-85 in the desired skill.

Read full topic

18779 - Nourished ancient effigy

18781 - Gorged ancient effigy

Taken from itemdb.biz

I guess they’re not like cluescrolls.
